Connie And Carla
Nia Vardalos  (Actor),     Toni Collette  (Actor),     Michael Lembeck  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles
['From the writer and star of My Big Fat Greek Wedding comes Connie and Carla, the hilarious new comedy the Chicago Sun-Times calls "a total delight!" Best friends Connie and Carla have always dreamed of fame and fortune, but their careers in show business are going nowhere fast. After witnessing a crime, they are forced to go on the run and keep their true identities secret. The dazzling duo stumble on an ingenious way to let their many talents shine. Now with a little luck–and lots of beauty products–they\'re going straight to the top, with plenty of side-splitting twists and turns along the way! Connie and Carla is an irresistible comedy-adventure filled with fun and loaded with laughter!Bonus Content:', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Outtakes', 'Outtakes', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Debbie Reynolds', 'Debbie Reynolds']

A Christmas Carol
Alastair Sim  (Actor),     Hermione Baddely  (Actor),     Brian Desmond Hurst  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Alastair Sim\'s tour-de-force performance as the ultimate miser, Ebenezer Scrooge, has almost single-handedly made this beloved version of Charles Dickens\' story into one of the best-loved Christmas films of all time. Some of Britain\'s best filmmakers united behind Sim, who was joined by a delightful cast of accomplished and acclaimed English actors; creating what many today believe to be the best and most faithful production of Dickens\' immortal tale. Cranky and curmudgeonly Scrooge learns the error of his unkind ways and is taught the true meaning of the holidays when he is visited by the ghost of his late business partner and the spirits of Christmas past, present and future. Special Features: Commentaries by Marcus Hearn and George Cole; Introduction by Leonard Maltin; "Dead to Begin With: The Darker Side of A Classic"- Explores the movies bleaker themes and how they rivaled London of the 1950\'s - features film historian and culturalist Sir Christopher Frayling; "Scrooge by Another Name: Distributing \'A Christmas Carol\'" - Details the American release of this British holiday classic as told by distributor Richard Gordon; "The Human Blarney Stone: Life and Times of Brian Desmond Hurst"; "The Alastair Sim Version: Too Good To Be Shown Only At Christmastime - video narrative by Fred Guida, author of \'A Christmas Carol and It\'s Adaptations\'; and A collection of early silent versions of Dickens on film.']
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.25 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25752733', 'Director': 'Brian Desmond Hurst', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, Black & White, Full Screen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 16, 2012', 'Actors': 'Alastair Sim, Hermione Baddely, Kathleen Harrison, Mervyn Johns, George Cole', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Vci Video', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Wonderful quality for a dated film.  This Christmas Carol film is not to be missed.  It is one of, if not the best of Christmas Carol movies made.
A classic for the whole family!!!!
Six Days, Seven Nights
Harrison Ford  (Actor),     Anne Heche  (Actor),     Ivan Reitman  (Director),     Michael Chapman  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
['Product Description', "Big-screen favorite Harrison Ford stars in this nonstop adventure hit about a dream vacation that turns into a hilarious tropical nightmare! A gruff, rough-hewn cargo pilot living in the islands, Quinn Harris (Ford) hates tourists ... though he's not above making a fast buck from a sharp-tongued New Yorker, Robin Monroe (sexy Anne Heche -- VOLCANO, WAG THE DOG), when she's desperate for a quick flight to Tahiti! But this already uneasy relationship suddenly takes a nosedive when his weather-beaten old plane is forced down in a storm! Now, stranded together on a deserted isle, Quinn and Robin quickly discover all the perils of paradise. As this mismatched pair find themselves facing danger at every turn, you're sure to find their misfortunes fueling one of Hollywood's most entertaining action-comedy hits in years!", 'Amazon.com', 'The African Queen', 'meets', 'Swept Away', 'in this sometimes labored romantic comedy by director Ivan Reitman. Fortunately, he cast an old pro in Harrison Ford, as Quinn Harris, a South Seas charter pilot who must ferry New York fashion editor Robin Monroe (Anne Heche) from one island to another--a hop that falls flat when they fly into a mammoth storm that causes them to crash on a deserted island. The pair resent and resist each other, until they are forced to team up to escape from the island--and some modern pirates who want their heads. If that part of the story is unconvincing, you can always focus on the smoldering comic chemistry between Heche, who displays strong comic instincts, and the ever-reliable Ford. The script is just an excuse for these two flinty characters to strike increasingly romantic sparks off each other, which is always enjoyable to watch.', '--Marshall Fine']

Music and Lyrics
Hugh Grant  (Actor),     Drew Barrymore  (Actor),     Marc Lawrence  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['Music and Lyrics (DVD) (WS)', "Hugh Grant and Drew Barrymore star as washed-up '80s pop star with a chance for a comeback and his quirky plant lady with a knack for lyrics. Alex Fletcher has been reduced to working the nostalgia circuit at county fairs & amusement parks. The charismatic & talented musician gets a chance at a comeback when reigning pop diva Cora Corman (Haley Bennett) invites him to write & record a duet with her, but there's a problem--Alex hasn't written a song in years; he's never written lyrics and he has to come up with a hit in a matter of days. Enter Sophie Fisher, Alex's beguilingly plant lady, whose flair for words strikes a chord with the struggling songwriter. On the rebound from a bad relationship with the newly famous novelist Sloan Cates, Sophie is reluctant to collaborate with anyone, especially commitment-phobe Alex. Now, Alex and Sophie will have to face their fears--& the music--to find the love & success they both deserve.", ']]>']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** Movies, with a strong focus on family, holiday-themed films, and classic cinema, particularly those directed by iconic filmmakers.
- **Genre Preference:** Enjoys romantic comedies, family-friendly films, classic dramas, and light-hearted ghost tales, demonstrating a growing appreciation for humor across various genres including action-comedy.
- **Format Preference:** Prefers physical media, especially DVDs, indicating a nostalgic connection to traditional viewing experiences. Recent purchases reflect a commitment to quality, with a focus on classic films; however, ongoing concerns about DVD reliability continue to influence choices.
- **Value-Conscious:** Seeks high-quality content that offers emotional resonance, and while eager to find good deals, past negative experiences with defective products have instilled a sense of caution in future purchasing decisions.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Strongly connected to films that evoke personal memories, especially vintage classics, enhancing the viewing experience.
- **Positive Engagement:** Consistently rates films highly and shares encouraging insights, with a recent emphasis on classic cinema. A recent interaction showcasing an appreciation for a classic film illustrates an enduring enthusiasm for quality entertainment despite previous disappointments with product functionality.

Overall, the user remains dedicated to films that provide nostalgic joy and feel-good experiences, balanced by a growing prudence in their purchasing behavior.
